title: Configure LDAP authentication for OO Workflow Designer
content:
After configuring the Operations Orchestration (OO) Workflow Designer to use IDM for authentication, you can setup a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) authentication for IDM directly from OO Workflow Designer.

The IdM server will use the LDAP configuration to authenticate and authorize user access to OO Workflow Designer. OO Workflow Designer supports a single LDAP configuration for an IdM server.

Create an LDAP authentication

To configure LDAP authentication using IdM administration console:

  1. From the ORGANIZATION menu, select the Authentication tab, and then click    . 
  2. In the Create Authentication dialog, click the Select authentication type drop-down list box and select LDAP.
  3. Enter the Display Name, Hostname, Port, SSL Connection, Certificate details, LDAP attributes, User login settings, and Group Settings for the LDAP server.
  4. Click SAVE.

If the LDAP server supports anonymous login, the "User ID (Full DN)" and "Password" can be blank.

If the LDAP configuration isn't saved, an asterisk (*) appears next to the domain name in the LDAP navigation pane to the left. If you leave the page before saving, a message appears, warning that there are unsaved changes. 

The following table shows configuration items on the LDAP authentication configuration page:

LDAP Server Settings

Configuration Items

Description

Display Name (mandatory)

LDAP authentication display name.

Hostname (mandatory)

LDAP server’s IP or Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) which can be analyzed by DNS.

Port (mandatory)

LDAP server’s port.

SSL Connection (check box) (optional)

Use LDAPS if checked, need to provide a certificate.

Certificate (optional)

LDAPS SSL certificate.

Validate Certificate (check box) (optional)

Try to verify certificate validation when creating LDAPS authentication if checked.

Base DN (mandatory)

User search base DN.

User ID (Full DN) (optional)

LDAP user’s DN used for login. Anonymous log in doesn't need to fill it. 

It's recommended to provide a privileged user, because some OO functionality uses searching, for example, the scheduler. If there is no privileged user, this functionality may not work correctly, depending on how the LDAP is configured.

For example, uid=john,ou=people,dc=devlab,dc=ad. Ensure that you use the exact DN for the user with these privileges.

Password (optional)

LDAP user’s password used for login. Anonymous log in doesn't need to fill it.

LDAP Attributes

Configuration Items

Description

Full Name (optional)

Specify which LDAP users’ attributes will be mapped to IdM users’ full names.

User Email (optional)

Specify which LDAP users’ attributes will be mapped to IdM users’ email.

Manager Identifier (optional)

Specify which LDAP users’ attributes will be mapped to IdM users’ manager identifier.

Manager Identifier Value (optional)

Specify which LDAP users’ attributes will be mapped to IdM users’ manager identifier value.

User Avatar (optional)

Specify which LDAP users’ attributes will be mapped to IdM users’ avatar.

Priority (optional)

If an organization has multiple LDAP authentications, you can set their priority to specify their order for user authentication verification.

Referral Search (check box) (optional)

Open LDAP referral search function when starting search if checked.

User Login Settings

Configuration Items

Description

User Name Attribute (mandatory)

Use users’ this attribute for IdM authentication. You can set the value for this field only once.

User Search Base (optional)

The base CN or DN or OU for searching users. For instance, ou=Users.

User Search Filter (mandatory)

The filter for user search. For instance, mail={0} means use the user’s email to search the user.

Search Subtree (check box)

Try to search users in Search Base’s subtree.

Group Settings

Configuration Items

Description

Group Name Attribute (optional)

Specify from which group to do a further search.

Group Object Classes (optional)

See also Group Search Filter. For instance, groupOfNames,groupOfUniqueNames,group.

Group Search Base (optional)

The base group for searching.

Group Search Filter (optional)

The filter for group search needs to use LDAP syntax.

Group Membership (optional)

Specify which attribute the group used to search its members. For instance, member,uniqueMember.

Load Group as Attribute (check box) (optional)

Load group as users’ attribute when authentication is created if checked.
